headline: Easy Lasagna
description: This easy lasagna recipe is made with lean ground beef, three types of cheese, and a jar of spaghetti sauce for a hearty, family-pleasing meal.

video.description: This top-rated recipe is lasagna made simple.
video.name: Easy Lasagna II

name: Easy Lasagna

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Stir in spaghetti sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
Combine cottage cheese, 2 cups of mozzarella cheese, eggs, 1/2 of the grated Parmesan cheese, dried parsley, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.

Spread 3/4 cup of sauce in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover with 3 uncooked lasagna noodles, 1 3/4 cups of cheese mixture, and 1/4 cup sauce; repeat layers once more. Top with remaining 3 noodles, sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese. Pour 1/2 cup water along the edges of the dish. Cover tightly with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! Added hamb and Italian sausage, used 48 oz of Veggie Primavera, added Italian seasoning and minced garlic. A real crowd pleaser!
Wonderful lasagna! I added garlic and Italian seasoning and extra mozzarella and parmasan cheese, we love cheese,mmmm yum!
my first time ever making lasagna, followed recipe exactly, everyone loved it.

Would make again based on how easy it is though it's not as amazing as Linda's Lasagna. I used Rao's marinara which is very oily. I don't think the water was needed. I ended up with a lot of extra liquid. I used jovial gluten free lasagna and did not pre-cook.

I boiled the lasagna noodles for about 8 minutes, added mozz provalone Parm cottage cheese and ricotta all together, browned the hamburger added ragu to the meat. Added the meat to the pan, added the noodles then the cheeses, continued until finished. Baked it about 45 mins uncovered it and went another 10. It came out great. I didn't measure the ingredients. it was my 1st lasagna. I left out the water.
I found this recipe a year ago and it is a hit every time I make it. if you Follow the recipe then you will feel like a gourmet chef.

My fiancé was wanting it . I usually use ricotta cheese but two stores I went to didn't have it so found this recipe used cottage cheese. I did add Italian sausage (johnsonville) and doubled the meat *(the man loves his meat). I added more cheese and another egg and it was quick and easy. I used oven ready noodles so I did bake it a little longer (40). He loved it and said it was the best I've made. So thank you for the recioe!!!
No it was good

I tweaked the recipe a bit. Used two pounds of meat, more pasta sauce, cut out the water, added diced onion and seasonings (garlic powder, salt, pepper) while browning the meat. Also added minced garlic to the cheese mixture. I used more than 9 noodles (probably more like 12). Since I added extra stuff, I baked for about 45 min covered and 15 uncovered, and then let sit for another 10-15. Delicious! Might try shredded parm next time for even more of a melty cheese kick. I overflowed my casserole dish, but the lasagna came out great!
Used shredded parmesan and ricotta
It was amazing, I made for my family for Christmas dinner..I added a little extra cheese and added mushrooms.

Made and used regular noodles, Xtra sauce Love Saucy, Spicy Italian Sausage and lil Xtra Park with some Cayenne sprinkled in; Came out FAB! And I’m No Cook! Hate cooking more into baking, but this was so simple had to try. Now a must have for Fam that Love it. Glad I actually tried it a real Win:)
Amazing recipe! Loved the simplicity; was able to use gluten free Barilla noodles and lactose free cottage cheese to suit our dietary needs. Superb!

Super easy and great lasagna. Next time I'll boil the noodles they were kinda chewy. I tweaked by using ricotta instead of cream cheese, added Italian seasoning instead of salt and pepper and used marinara instead of spaghetti sauce!! And husband says it's way cheaper than olive garden!!
This is so good and really easy. A real winner of a recipe.
Everyone absolutely loved it!!!
Easy and delicious. I've made it several times. One of the few recipes that my whole family enjoys
Great recipe but it's missing minced garlic. That would improve it. I would add 2 T of minced garlic or you can add an equivalent of fresh garlic.
So good it's hard to believe how easy and affordable it is!!
Absolutely loved it.!!!!
Family loved it! I subbed Italian sausage for beef and used garlic sauce. Very soupy at first, but firmed up nicely as it cooled down.
This was easy to prepare and the end result was amazing!! I made it for my husband for his birthday and he was beyond excited.
This recipe turned out perfect. I made it for Father's day dinner and it was it! It is now Father's day staple!
This was a great recipe that the family loved will continue to make it
Just followed the recipe! Delicious!
I added ricotta cheese,red onions,extra parmasan,little extra salt and a stick of butter. Turned out so deliciouss
Perfect & simpler for oven ready noodles even gluten free!
This was such a great recipe….all I added was sugar because I’m one that enjoys the taste of a sweet sauce.
My first time it was ok! The second time I made it, it was even better. My family and friends gave me an A+. I really outdid myself! It was really good!

The easiest and best tasting lasagna I've made, including authentic Italian recipes that take twice as long. I made a full recipe with the following tweaks - it will take at least *1 HOUR* to bake, so allow enough time. I used a 28oz container of Daisy cottage cheese and a cup of Fage plain Greek yogurt. I added a cup of chopped onions and ~ a teaspoon of cayenne pepper. I used all 15 of the thin, no bake noodles, 3 per layer in a 9 x 13, this turned out amazing. The addition of the cayenne really helped punch it up. If you use the no bake noodles, make sure to add the 1/2 cup of water around the edges before baking. This can also be scaled down for a 9X9 pan. The amount of cottage cheese is too much - I used 12 oz. for a 9X9. I still used 2 eggs, 8 oz (2 cups) of mozzarella and used lasagna sheets. The sheets are slightly thinner than regular lasagna noodles and fit perfectly in a 9X9. Allow a full hour for baking. Although it looked soupy when I took it out of the oven, after 10 minutes it was fine. I used regular (not no bake)lasagna noodles and Ragu.
So easy and my family loves it!
This is my second time making this lasagna. I have never cooked this dish before and it was so easy to make and the directions were easy to follow!!! My family loves this meal!!!
Very wet followed recipe to the T. Scouped. It out very messy.
Tastes amazing and easy to make!

This is my go-to for lasagne. I make this as a gift whenever someone is dealing with a tragedy or recent birth of a child and for my family a few time a year. It’s so yummy! My only suggestion is broil it for a few min at the end to make the cheese bubbly and brown bits. It’s so gooey! And if you like a lil spice, you can do 1/2 beef and 1/2 sausage. Oh and if you’re in a rush, pre cook your lasagne noodles. I just made it tonight with the precooked noodles and it cooked in 30 min instead of 45.

The recipe is tasty, BUT… cottage cheese is already far more watery than Ricotta, so adding 1/2 C of water to the dish, as the recipe directs, ensures the lasagna becomes a soup… So a word to the wise: Do NOT add 1/2 C water.
Family loves it. The change I made was I boiled my noodles as I browned my ground beef which was no big deal. So I deleted the water. I also burn my cheese on top at the very end.

I have made this recipe many, many times and it always turns out PERFECT! Its easy, its fun to prepare, and whatever is left over saves well so I get multiple meals from it!

I share this recipe all the time and it will always be my go-to lasagna!

Plus, I'm happy to be its 800th review!

My second time making it. I used to eat cottage cheese when I was younger and on the Richard Simmons diet. Lol I hadn't eaten it since then. This recipe reminded me how much I love it. I don't use as much as the recipe asks for because I end up eating about a quarter of it. Ty so much for this recipe. Sometimes I share my meals with neighbors. They can make there own. This is all mine. What I don't finish I will separate into serving sizes and freeze. Ty again

Lasagna is one of those dishes that is tricky...either it's dry or too strong or too bland...bit this one (with a few modifications) is a perfect base to be tweaked to personal preferences. After reading some other reviews for ideas, I decided to use half ground turkey and half hot Italian turkey sausage. I used half cottage cheese and half ricotta cheese, but definitely the while amount the recipe calls for. For the shredded cheese I used an Italian cheese blend in place of the mozzarella (much tastier). I added Italian seasoning and omitted the salt (doesn't need it with all that cheese). It was absolutely delicious!

I used the no cook lasagna noodles so that worked out great as far as the noodles but it did spill over my pan a bit..so keep that in mind. Normally I use regular lasagna noodles but I do cook them a bit so that they are easier to work with still and they soak up some of the liquids to finish cooking in the oven and I've never had any spill over doing it that way. I do that cuz I have never done a recipe w/ uncooked noodles that every worked out. I also add a bit of Italian sausage w/ the beef....and I add some extra spices to the jarred sauce...but overall I follow the recipe. I do use cottage cheese even cuz I usually have that on hand. Great recipe...but if ya know your cooking history tweek it how ya need to to make it work for ya.

The written recipe and the video differ in the amount of times you repeat the layers. The written recipe says to repeat once and the video says twice. I think the video is correct because that way you use up all the ricotta cheese filling. For those who say it is soupy, I think you missed a layer which means fewer noodles to absorb the liquid. I hope this helps. Other than that, this is a great way to quickly make lasagna. I prefer the old fashion way and making sauce, but this is good when you are short on time.

Don’t add the water. 
Lasagna soup with hard nooooooodles

Very tasty! Supermarket ran out of ricotta cheese so I substituted it with 360g of cream cheese instead. I don’t eat beef, so I also substituted it with minced pork. I also used about 1/4 cup of water instead of the suggested amount, which was still a bit much. Despite these changes to the recipe the result was still great! Would definitely make this again. Next time, I’d go with less cheese and even less water though. Thanks for the easy tasty recipe!
We like a meaty cheesy lasagna. We used more hamburger and 4 cheeses. Mozzarella, ricotta, cottage and parmesan, amazing flavor. I wasn't able to get a picture before everyone dug in
Delish!!!!!! I prefer ricotta which can easily be swapped out for the cottage cheese. Also I added diced tomatoes ?? ?? definitely recommend
Love it and would definitely make again.
great
Love this recipe !! The only thing I change To make it even more easier is I used oven ready lasagna pasta and I do not add the water.. it turns out great and my whole family loves it !

This has become a family favorite. SOOOOOO easy to make! Few substitutions....used Ricotta cheese instead of cottage and used spicy/hot country sausage instead of ground beef. I’m alllllll about keeping it simple- so, I use large jar of Prego Traditional sauce. This has become a hit and a staple item for our family!

Super easy and very tasty! My sister hates cottage cheese, but she never even noticed it was in this. I was worried it would be too "saucy" something my nephew objects to, but once it baked and sat for the 10-15 minutes after, it all came together satisfyingly. I did use ground turkey instead of beef because we don't eat beef, but it didn't make a bit of difference to taste.

I had to use gluten free noodles because I’m Celiacs. I cooked the noodles, drained then rinsed using cold water. I used ricotta cheese instead and put some oregano in instead or parsley it came out absolutely delicious!!
Great and super easy, I just added sliced onions and additional salt and pepper to my recipe to season it a bit more.
I added Cheddar and Colby jack cheese and it was delish!
Easy & Delicious!
This was the best lasagna I ever had!
I followed recipe on point. Very soupy and the noodles definitely were not cooked.
My new go to! So easy. I sauté veggies (onion, peppers, mushrooms) with my meat and it is a nice addition.
Yummy as always
love this recipe! very easy to make and everybody loves it.
It was easy just as it says!!! It tastes really amazing!! I'm soooooo proud of myself!!! Thanks for the recipe!!
It was so easy to make and my family loved it.

I did it wrong, but it still came out pretty good. I forgot to include the 2 eggs. It was a little soupy at first but after a while it set. Everyone ate it, so it must have been good. I like this recipe because it's fast and you don't have to boil noodles.

I use this recipe as a base every time I make lasagna. I usually end up needing more sauce so I use about a jar and a half instead of just a jar and with the amount of cottage cheese I usually end up with an extra layer of noodles on top.

I have a vegetarian friend so I even have made it with veggie ground round instead of ground beef and it tastes just the same. It was a hit.

Like I said, a great base and easy to adjust to the taste of whoever happens to be eating it. I've added spinach or mushrooms or onions or whatever I have on hand.

The only change I made was I substituted jarred spaghetti sauce for my own homemade. I’ve never made lasagna without boiling noodles before. This was so simple and absolutely fabulous! My only suggestion...mpo, I like my top cheeses a little browner...mostly for aesthetic purposes. After 10 minutes at end, before setting, I would put under broiler for 2-3 minutes...or until it’s the eye pleasing color of your choice. Best lasagna ever!
I altered slightly by adding 1lbs of Italian sausage and adding more sauce but this recipe was super easy and delicious... Thanks
Very good recipe but ya too much cheese mixture! Wasted like a cup of the cheese mixture. Added diced onions and salt to my browning meat. Really yummy and turned out great!

I love this recipe and use it often - it is very easy, not too time consuming and tastes wonderful. I like to use ground turkey instead of beef, and add some finely diced onions and salt & pepper while it is browning. I use whole grain lasagna noodles. I agree with another reviewer that the cheese mixture is a bit much as the recipe is currently written - I like to use 15 - 20 oz of cottage cheese instead of 32. Everything else I do the same. It comes out great and I even get compliments from my picky eater stepsons
I thought it was very tasty. I believe it could use just a bit more liquid. Maybe increase the water to 3/4 cup.
Delish

This is my go-to and only recipe for lasagna and it's the only one I've tried. I add in veggies with the ground beef, diced onions and today chopped mushrooms (to get more veggies into my kids). Sometimes I layer with spinach (1) because I am slightly anemic so it's a good source of iron and (2) the layer is so thin my kids don't/can't really complain about it. I also use all ricotta instead of cottage cheese. This recipe has yet to let me down!
This worked out well. We really liked it. I will say that it is a lot of sauce. Wonder if the sauce is what cooks the noodles. I will be making this whenever I have a taste for Lasagna.
No onions ? Pretty good but needs onions cooked with the beef.
This recipe was delicious, whole family loved it. Very easy to make! I did add some smoked sausage slices for extra flavor
This is my favorite lasagna recipe. It’s easy to make and quite fast. The only change I make on this recipe is: instead of cottage cheese, I use ricotta cheese. My husband loves it!

It was so easy to make! My son loved it!!!!
Thank you so much!
I love this recipe. I make it all the time. It is easy to layer and comes out great every time.
Nope no changes. Made it just the way it notes. For sure I'll be making it again. My 5 yr loves any pasta that has RED SAUCE in it. Th for sharing this recipe
I tweaked it and in a pinch this is great
I ran out of sauce by the last layer. I would double the meat sauce portion. I also added lots of other shredded cheeses. My husband doesn't like cottage cheese but he loved this! So easy!

The only alterations I made to this recipe were more sauce, less water, and I cooked my beef with some garlic and onion. Not sure why some people felt there was too much cheese. I used 32 oz cottage cheese just as it said and it was perfect. Even my super picky 11 year old son liked it. Definitely a keeper in our house.
I made this recipe last night and my family loved it. We’ll definitely be having it again.
I substituted ricotta for the cottage cheese. It was even better!!
Love it!! More importantly, the hubby loves it more..

This was good. I used sausage because I have a ton and was trying to find ways to use it. I cut down the cottage cheese slightly and add some tomato sauce to the spaghetti sauce to get the proportions more in line. I also used the no boil lasagna noodles and worked great and had nice flavor.
Definitely cut the amount of cottage cheese by half.
Super easy, really good.

I made this for my boyfriend's birthday and he actually excited to have leftovers! I tweaked it a bit by using 2 parts cottage cheese & 1 part ricotta. I also used shredded "Italian Blend" cheese instead of just the shredded mozzarella to kick up the flavor a bit. This has moved up to a favorite recipe in our book!

My husband loves lasagna. I HATE making it. This recipe was very tasty, and so easy to throw together. I loved using the oven ready lasagna noodles. It means one less pot to clean, since I don’t have to boil noodles. I added about 5-6 packets of Splenda to my sauce to cut the tangy flavor. I also used ricotta instead of cottage cheese. If you’re looking for a basic, no frills lasagna recipe that will please most people, this is it.
Turned out perfect!! Very yummy!!

I usually don't like cottage cheese in my lasagna, but this one was delicious! We made a half recipe, but it was still so good! The half recipe called for 4 1/2 lasagna noodles, but we made it with 9 and it was delicious! I definitely recommend this recipe for a quiet night at home :)

My family loved it! I didn't add salt because I find cottage cheese and Parmesan Cheese make it salty enough and I run cottage cheese in a food processor briefly just to get more of a traditional ricotta-ish texture. So far the best recipe I found for lasagna without precooked noodles is a spinach lasagna so my family was so happy to finally get a "meat" lasagna with no green stuff lol! This was delicious. I did add a little garlic and onion to the meat while browning but I always do that and I'm sure this would have been just great without it.
Would not change a thing! Was really worried that noodles wouldn't cook. But they turned out perfectly! So very excited to use this recipe again.
I used to love this site, but now the ads take up half the page. It is very annoying. I’ll be using other sites more.
First time making this recipe! Much easier with uncooked noodles. I’ll be making this again!
Very easy!! Taste great!

Loved it! I haven't made lasagna in years. When I did make it, I never boiled the noodles. Fast forward to this Christmas eve and a request from my youngest who was flying in from AZ. My favorite brand of gf pasta is Tinkyada but I saw a rice/corn blend from Barilla, which I picked up instead. I used 1/2 ricotta and 1/2 cottage plus two jars of sauce. I look at recipes for suggestions and break off with what I have on hand and what I know from past experience. I season the meat and add the water into the sauce. I found a shaved blend of asiago, parmesan, and Romano with which I am a little heavy handed. I ended up having more cheese blend so I made a second, smaller dish. Everyone loved it. Today is the 3rd time I've made it and I'm using beyond meat and since I'm low on noodles, I have a two layers of baby spinach. Hoping it is just as good!

I like this one, and I love the cheesiness. My family likes a little more chunky, so I added a can of diced tomatoes, undrained. Honestly, I think it helped with the moisture issue too. I always doctor my sauce, since we like garlic a lot, and today I plan to use Italian sausage instead of ground beef. This recipe is my go-to for the technique, but I never make it the same twice.
My family loved this lasagna recipe. I loved how quick and easy it went together. This will be my go to recipe for lasagna for now on.
